acts.title: The First Handover
steps: You’re preparing your child’s bag. Your ex texts: “Running late, 15 min.”
Do you wait calmly and note it, or reply with a frustrated message?
You take a breath and choose a neutral tone. The handover completes without drama.

acts.title: Scheduling & Boundaries
steps: A public holiday is coming up. Both of you want the day.
You propose a rotate‑each‑year rule and document it in the shared calendar.
Tension lowers as expectations become predictable.

acts.title: Medical Decisions
steps: Your child needs a dentist appointment. Times clash with ex’s work.
You offer two alternatives and send the clinic’s contact details.
The appointment is confirmed without blame or sarcasm.

acts.title: New Partners
steps: Your ex mentions introducing a new partner to the child.
You ask for a gradual approach: short, neutral meetings in public spaces first.
Agreement reached: both will follow the same rule for new partners.

acts.title: Readiness Check
steps: Are you emotionally ready? List three signs you are, and three you’re not.

acts.title: House Rules
steps: You and your partner set clear, consistent rules for all kids.

acts.title: Crisis Plan
steps: You agree on early‑warning signals and a plan for de‑escalation.
